summary: This document is an email from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to SEC officials, appealing a preliminary denial of his whistleblower award application. He alleges extensive SEC corruption, obstruction, and protection of criminal enterprises involved in money laundering, market manipulation, and fraud, specifically naming entities like Knight Capital/KCG/VIRT/NITE, Net Element (NETE), and individuals like Michael Farkas and Justin Keener.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the email, appealing SEC's denial of his whistleblower award and alleging widespread corruption, obstruction, and protection of criminal enterprises by the SEC.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: SEC recipient of Dilorio's email, accused of failing to produce the record for his whistleblower award determination and being part of the obstruction.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: SEC official referenced by Dilorio as part of the group that received his emails and allegedly involved in corrupt obstruction.

persons.name: Michael Farkas
persons.role: CEO of New Image Concepts/Blink Charging
persons.context: Alleged to be a 'bag man' and CEO of a money laundering shell, with questions raised about how he escaped an SEC complaint related to SkyWay.

persons.name: Jonathan Farkas
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to Michael Farkas and Trump fundraising, questioned if related to Michael Farkas.

persons.name: Engel
persons.context: Described as a 'Milken/Drexel flunkie' on the Blink Charging (BLNK) Board of Directors, implying corrupt connections.

persons.name: Crede
persons.context: Linked to Net Element fraud, Milken, Putin, and money laundering allegations.

persons.name: Milken
persons.context: Repeatedly mentioned in connection with fraudulent entities like Net Element, Esousa, Cobblestone, and associates like Engel.

persons.name: Peizer
persons.context: Linked to Net Element fraud and related fraudulent offerings (Esousa, Cobblestone).

persons.name: Clayton
persons.context: Accused of not disclosing conflicts of interest related to Sullivan & Cromwell, Jared Fishman, and NITE, and called to step down.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Alleged to have played a key role in keeping the 'criminal entity' NITE/VIRT operational.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Linked to Hanover/Magna and multiple shells (CGFIA, IMDS, NewLead, FreeSeas, PRTH); subject of an SEC complaint regarding bogus notes.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Detailed in Dilorio's 2013 TCR; involved with World Trade Financial, barred by FINRA as a 'Bad Actor', and later involved with Blink Charging/New Image Concepts.

persons.name: Ajay Tandon
persons.context: Defendant in an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump schemes related to Net Element (NETE).

persons.name: Amit Tandon
persons.context: Defendant in an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump schemes related to Net Element (NETE).

persons.name: Berger
persons.context: SEC official with whom Dilorio filed a 2013 TCR.

persons.name: McKessy
persons.context: SEC official who has been in possession of Dilorio's 2013 TCR and emails.

connections.description: Dilorio is a whistleblower appealing to SEC official Janey regarding the denial of his award and alleging obstruction.
Questioned if they are related, both described as 'bag men' in the context of financial schemes.
Engel is on the Board of Directors of Blink Charging (BLNK), a company where Michael Farkas is CEO, with both linked to Milken/Drexel connections.
Linked in allegations of fraud related to Net Element, Esousa, and Cobblestone entities.
Both are described as 'bag men' involved in money laundering shells and subject to regulatory actions (FINRA/SEC).
Both associated with Sullivan & Cromwell; Fishman alleged to help keep NITE/VIRT running, a conflict Clayton did not disclose.
Brothers and co-founders of SeeThroughEquity, both defendants in an SEC pump-and-dump complaint related to Net Element.

events.title: Dilorio's Formal Appeal Email
events.description: Christopher J. Dilorio sends an email appealing the SEC's preliminary denial of his whistleblower award application, alleging massive corruption and obstruction.

events.title: Dilorio's Summary Email to SEC
events.description: Dilorio sent a summary email to SEC officials (Janey, Hoecker, commissioners) formalizing his appeal and summarizing hundreds of previous emails.

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThroughEquity
events.description: The SEC filed a complaint against SeeThroughEquity, LLC, Ajay Tandon, and Amit Tandon for pump-and-dump schemes, which Dilorio claims involved Net Element (NETE).

events.title: SEC Jaclin 'Shell Factory' Complaint
events.description: The SEC filed a complaint against Jaclin et al., detailing 'shell factory' operations, which included New Image Concepts (later Blink Charging).

events.title: FINRA Bars Justin Keener
events.description: FINRA barred Justin Keener/JMJ as a 'Bad Actor' for inadequate anti-money laundering programs and other violations.

locations: Washington (state, implied for Mullen EV production)
keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher J. Dilorio, alleges the SEC is engaged in 'EXTRAORDINARY corrupt obstruction' to protect criminal enterprises and deny him rightful whistleblower awards.
Dilorio specifically accuses entities like Knight Capital/KCG/VIRT/NITE and Net Element (NETE) of being involved in massive fraud, money laundering, and market manipulation, with SEC complicity.
The email claims the SEC facilitated fraud by allowing Net Element to remain operational, receive CARES Act funds, and conduct reverse mergers despite being insolvent.
Multiple individuals are named as 'bag men' or key figures in alleged schemes: Michael Farkas, Jonathan Farkas, Joshie Sason, Justin Keener, and associates of Milken.
Dilorio calls for immediate shutdown of the OTC Markets (OTCM), the Obligation Warehouse (OW), AQR shells, and the resignation of all SEC officials who handled his information.
